## Using git

git is a command line version control system. We can use it from RStudio (via "git pane" in the upper left) or from the command line(i.e. in the "Terminal Tab)

The steps to using git involve:

- Initiate a git repository
  get init (command line)
  or click the little box in RStudio
  
- Do your work (same as ever)
  add files
  edit files
  save files
  
- **Add files you care about to the "stage"**
  git add yourfilename
  git add . (adds all files)
  click to add to "stage" in RStudio
  
- **Commit your changes**
  git commit -m "your message"
  click "commit" button in RStudio
  
**Using the command prompt will make future lectures easier**
